column4: hey guys, I have a very strange issue... I enabled the 3rd party repositories, but a lot of packages seem to be missing.  For example, when i try to install xchat I get an error that says xchat is not available but referred to by other packages.
I'm also getting issues with Gnome-do
installing it, that is

jezza;  you're doing it wrong.  use the command line and make sure you enabled the third party repositories.  I'm willing to be it's there.  use "aptitude search" to find the package (try "active-sync" or "activesync" or something like that"
jezza;  use the 'aptitude search' command
like i said above
jezza;  Make sure you enable the third party repositories first.  they're under "software sources" in the System>Admin menu

I enabled the 3rd party repositories, but a lot of packages seem to be missing.  For example, when i try to install xchat I get an error that says xchat is not available but referred to by other packages.
anybody know what's up?
update, upgrade, try again.
i did that already
I checked that the repos were enabled, updated, upgraded, etc...
sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get upgrade,     then try reinstalling xchat.. try it again, or try a dist-upgrade perhaps..
the only time ive ever seen a similer error was when the updates got out of sync
or some repos got disabled some how
tried dist-upgrade as well
this is a fresh installation, so i'm a bit confused
perhaps compare to my /etc/apt/sources.list ---> mine for an example --> (lots of stuff added to it) http://pastebin.com/f696cda99
hmmm i see you enabled backports and proposed.  think that could be it?
no idea. i always tend to just enable everyting. :)
i dont think that would be it however.
I concur...
let me pastebin both outputs.  I have a different one for gnome-do and xchat
or anybody really... here are the errors I'm getting from apt-get.  http://pastebin.com/m4240056d
